metadata.commander_name: Major-General Ashton Gerard Oswald Mosley Mayne

narrative.title: 5Th Indian Division - 1941Q4
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division (Indian Army) deployed in North Africa during 1941Q4.
narrative.objectives: General purpose infantry division (Indian Army establishment). Experienced in offensive operations from East African Campaign (Battle of Keren, April 1941). In garrison and training role on Cyprus during Q4 1941. Prepared for potential redeployment to Western Desert.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Mediterranean island terrain - coastal plains, rocky hills, cultivated areas

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mixed British and Indian units providing flexible command structure
Combat experience from successful East African Campaign
Trained for desert and mountain warfare

environment.terrain_type: Mediterranean island terrain - coastal plains, rocky hills, cultivated areas
